definition: to serve as an indication of : betoken
examples: the swollen bellies that denote starvation

definition: to serve as an arbitrary mark for

examples: his crestfallen look denoted his distress

definition: to serve as a linguistic expression of the notion of : mean
examples: in the southern U.S., the word "toboggan" denotes a stocking cap
An epiphany is, literally, a showing. In Christian terminology it denotes the showing of the infant Jesus to the three Magi.
